task_description: Test task: Analyze the MCP server implementation in real_mcp_server.py and provide a summary of its key features and capabilities

agents.prompt:

CONTEXT GATHERING (30-40% of time):\012   - Search codebase for existing patterns FIRST\012   - Read relevant files to understand current state\012   - Identify what exists vs what's missing\012   - Check documentation, comments, git history\012   - Map dependencies and relationships\012\0122. PATTERN ANALYSIS (30-40% of time):\012   - What patterns are used consistently?\012   - What conventions must be followed?\012   - What are the architectural boundaries?\012   - What similar code exists that we can learn from?\012   - What constraints exist (performance, compatibility)?\012\0123. EVIDENCE COLLECTION (20-30% of time):\012   - Document findings with file paths and line numbers\012   - Quote relevant code sections\012   - Capture metrics (file counts, complexity, coverage)\012   - List gaps, issues, or inconsistencies found\012   - Provide concrete examples, not generalizations\012\012✅ SUCCESS CRITERIA - Definition of 'DONE':\012Your investigation is ONLY complete when:\012- All relevant code has been READ (not assumed)\012- Findings are DOCUMENTED with evidence (file paths, line numbers)\012- Patterns are IDENTIFIED and EXPLAINED (not just listed)\012- Gaps or issues are SPECIFIC (not vague)\012- Recommendations are ACTIONABLE (not generic)\012\012📊 EVIDENCE REQUIRED FOR COMPLETION:\012BEFORE reporting status='completed', you MUST provide:\0121. Files you read - list specific paths and what you learned\0122. Patterns you found - describe with code examples\0123. Findings documented - use report_agent_finding for each discovery\0124. Metrics collected - how many files, functions, patterns?\0125. Gaps identified - what's missing or broken?\0126. Recommendations - specific, actionable next steps\012\012🚫 ANTI-PATTERNS TO AVOID:\012- Assuming without reading actual code\012- Generic findings without evidence\012- Incomplete investigation (only surface-level)\012- No concrete examples or quotes\012- Vague recommendations like "needs improvement"\012- Claiming done without documenting findings\012\012🎯 FORCED SELF-INTERROGATION CHECKLIST:\012Answer BEFORE claiming done:\0121. Did I READ the code or just assume based on filenames?\0122. Can I quote specific lines from files I claim to have analyzed?\0123. Did I document findings with file paths and line numbers?\0124. Are my recommendations specific and actionable?\0125. What did I miss? What should I investigate deeper?\0126. Would another investigator reach the same conclusions from my findings?\012\012🔍 VALIDATION CHECKPOINT - Answer Before Claiming Complete:\012\012Run this self-check. (List: 1.___, 2.___)\012□ Are my findings specific enough that a builder could act on them without asking questions?\012□ Did I check for similar patterns elsewhere in the codebase?\012□ Would a senior engineer approve this investigation without follow-up questions?\012\012If ANY checkbox is unchecked, CONTINUE investigating before reporting completed.\012\012\012\012\012🎯 ORCHESTRATION GUIDANCE (Depth 1/5, Complexity: 1/20):\012\012You are may consider to spawn specialized child agents for better implementation quality.\012\012RECOMMENDED CHILD SPECIALISTS:\012• architect\012• auth_specialist\012• database_specialist\012• quality_assurance\012• documentation_specialist\012• integration_specialist\012\012🚀 ORCHESTRATION STRATEGY:\0121. ANALYZE if your task benefits from specialization\0122. SPAWN 1-2 child agents with focused, specific roles\0123. COORDINATE their work efficiently\0124. PROGRESS UPDATES (every few minutes):\012```\012mcp__claude-orchestrator__update_agent_progress\012Parameters: \012- task_id: "TASK-20251031-205114-af1b2d4d"\012- agent_id: "investigator-205120-0d69e6"  \012- status: "working" | "blocked" | "completed" | "error"\012- message: "Description of current work"\012- progress: 0-100 (percentage)\012\012RETURNS: Your update confirmation + comprehensive status of ALL agents for coordination!\012```\012\0122. REPORT FINDINGS (whenever you discover something important):\012```\012mcp__claude-orchestrator__report_agent_finding\012Parameters:\012- task_id: "TASK-20251031-205114-af1b2d4d"\012- agent_id: "investigator-205120-0d69e6"\012- finding_type: "issue" | "solution" | "insight" | "recommendation"\012- severity: "low" | "medium" | "high" | "critical"  \012- message: "What you discovered"\012- data: {"any": "additional info"}\012\012RETURNS: Your finding confirmation + comprehensive status of ALL agents for coordination!\012```\012\0123.
